factText: Information: 541-966-3600 ☎ Dispatch: 541-966-3651 ▪FB: Umatilla County Sheriff's Office 🚨 Residents in #flooded areas should 'prepare to shelter in place' for weeks.
If you need assistance for floods or storms - call the NSW SES on 132 500.

Given that the soil is still soaked and so many of our rivers and creeks remain in flood, or are at least running high, this leaves Middle Tennessee especially vulnerable to additional flooding next week.

Those areas that were hardest hit this past week (close to the Alabama state line and the Cumberland Plateau south of I-40) stand to receive the heaviest rain. Flooding is reported around Forster. , officials say flooding from Cumberland River jumping its banks is “the worst since 1977.”
The South Central Ambulance Service said that Kents Hill Park, a conference center and hotel, will be used to house returning citizens after landing at RAF Brize Norton.
informationNeeds: CrisisFACTS-011_general_Where can displaced people find emergency housing?

factText: The government is making plans to freeze all trips from China once the last group of British evacuees is rescued from Wuhan, beaten by the coronavirus.
informationNeeds: CrisisFACTS-011_general_Are evacuation orders still in place or have they been lifted?

factText: A warning is issued when a hazardous weather or hydrologic event is occurring, imminent or likely. An advisory is issued when a hazardous weather or hydrologic event is occurring, imminent or likely
Inundation of low lying areas along the river continues, affecting portions of Moss Wright Park on Mansker Creek and industrial property along Dry Creek.

The National Weather Service in Nashville has issued a * Flood Advisory for The Buffalo River Near Lobelville *. The National Weather Service in Nashville has issued a * Flood Advisory for The Elk River Near Prospect *
Water begins to flood Veto Rd near the Hargrove - Johnson bridge south of Route 273. At 14.0 feet..Gilmer Bridge Rd and Russell Creek Rd begin to flood.
informationNeeds: CrisisFACTS-011_Flood_Which roads and bridges have been closed due to flooding?

factText: For those who have been forced to leave flooded homes, the need for food, clothing, shoes, a warm blanket is essential.

Salvation Army The Pendleton Salvation Army is providing vouchers for clothing, blankets and shoes for anyone who has been evacuated due to flooding and has need. Volunteers are onsite to assist with loading sandbags into vehicles and advice on how to protect your property from flash flooding. Mountain Warriors are stepping up to help our local community after the recent flooding in SE Kentucky.

The city of Pendleton has set up a shelter at the Pendleton Convention Center for those displaced by flooding. Happening now: Members of Det. 1, HHC, 1st Battalion, 149th Infantry "Mountain Warriors" are on orders providing support to the victims of the flooding in Williamsburg after Governor Andy Beshear’s emergency declaration in Southeast KY. For emergency assistance in floods and storms call 132 500 ☎️ #NSWSES #NSWRFS
informationNeeds: CrisisFACTS-011_Flood_Are there ongoing rescue operations for people trapped in floodwaters?

factText: The recent flooding at Nemo has subsided, but now there is cleanup work to be done. While the rest of us should experience lesser overall amounts, the threat of additional flooding still exists for all of Middle Tennessee.
informationNeeds: CrisisFACTS-011_Flood_What emergency measures are in place to prevent further flooding?

factText: Road closure updates for Umatilla County

ROAD CLOSURE UPDATE FROM THE UMATILLA COUNTY SHERIFF'S OFFICE: February 8, 2020 Pendleton – Due to flooding, the following roads are closed: Bingham Road Milton-Freewater: Mill Creek Road Walla Walla River Road closed at 15th Street Bridge to end of road at Harris Park Couse Creek Road—Walla Walla River east to Walla Walla River Road Spofford Road closed at intersection Milton Cemetery Road south to Walla Walla River Road.

The Umatilla County Sheriff's Office has issued the following release on road closures in the area due to flooding: Bingham Road Milton-Freewater: Mill Creek Road Walla Walla River Road closed at 15th Street Bridge to end of road at Harris Park Couse Creek Road—Walla Walla River east to Walla Walla River Road Spofford Road closed at intersection Milton Cemetery Road south to Walla Walla River Road.

The severe weather has caused power outages for about 70,000 customers across the Ausgrid network today. Power outages in several areas across the Hunter including Fullerton Cove, Valentine, Mount Hutton, Waratah, Mannering Park, Cams Wharf and Nords Wharf.
This list covers full closures of interstates, ramps, bridges and primary roads, and single-lane closures at the bridge-tunnels and the Berkley, High Rise and James River bridges.
For help in floods and storms call the SES on 132 500 For non-emergency police matters call 131 444 #NSWSES #NSWRFS #Floods #Emergency
informationNeeds: CrisisFACTS-011_general_What emergency numbers should people call for help during {event}?
